metadata.title: CVE-2015-3008 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Asterisk Open Source 1.8 before 1.8.32.3, 11.x before 11.17.1, 12.x before12.8.2, and 13.x before 13.3.2 and Certified Asterisk 1.8.28 before1.8.28-cert5, 11.6 before 11.6-cert11, and 13.1 before 13.1-cert2, whenregistering a SIP TLS device, does not properly handle a null byte in adomain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) field of an X.509certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof arbitrarySSL servers via a crafted certificate issued by a legitimate CertificationAuthority.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-config - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-modules - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-tests - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4').
